title: Peppermint Tea Facts, Health Benefits And Side Effects
author: Nderitu Munuhe; K Fleming
description: What are the peppermint tea benefits, side effects, and more? Read this article to find out all the answers.
cleaned_text: Peppermint tea is a popular herbal drink that has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for centuries. It is most often consumed as an iced tea but can also be enjoyed hot, or you can also combine it with other ingredients to create flavorful beverages. The soothing flavor of peppermint makes it the perfect drink to soothe frazzled nerves and enjoy during any time of day. Peppermint has many potential health benefits, which we'll review in this article. It also has a few side effects worth noting. Below, we will tackle the things you need to know. Peppermint Tea Health Benefits Peppermint tea is often consumed for its flavor, but it also is also believed to have several [health benefits.](https://betterme.world/articles/puer-tea-benefits-side-effects/) The tea itself has rarely been studied scientifically, but peppermint extracts have. Here are the science-backed [benefits](https://betterme.world/articles/hibiscus-tea-benefits-side-effects/) of this plant: Eases Stomach Upsets Peppermint oil is sometimes used to soothe gastrointestinal symptoms like stomach cramps, bloating and flatulence. It works by helping to [relax](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5814329/) the smooth muscle of the [bowel wall](https://www.nhs.uk/medicines/peppermint-oil/#:~:text=Peppermint%20oil%20is%20a%20type,Peppermint%20oil%20comes%20as%20capsules). It is not clear whether drinking peppermint tea would have the same effect, but some people do find that it helps with stomach upsets. Might Protect Against Cancer The antioxidants in peppermint tea have been shown to have anti-tumor activity in a test tube.s ( [2](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1002/ptr.1936)). Boosts Mood And Cognitive Performance Peppermint aroma has been shown to enhance memory and increase alertness ( [13](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18041606/)). Improves Symptoms Of Dysmenorrhea Peppermint has been used as a home remedy for menstrual [cramps](https://betterme.world/articles/herbal-tea-benefits-side-effects/). One study found that peppermint extract helped to reduce period pain and other symptoms ( [9](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4979258/)). Read More: [Ginger Cinnamon Tea Facts, Health Benefits And Side Effects](https://betterme.world/articles/ginger-cinnamon-tea-benefits-side-effects/) Boosts Exercise Performance One study found that consuming peppermint essential oil helped improve exercise performance, possibly by improving breathing and/or reducing pain ( [16](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3607906/)). Relieves Tension Headaches One preliminary study showed that applying peppermint oil on the forehead and temples helped relieve tension headaches ( [14](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00482-016-0109-6)). May Stimulate Hair Growth One study in mice found that 3% peppermint oil could promote hair growth when applied topically, possibly by increasing blood flow to hair follicles ( [15](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4289931/)). If you do decide to try this, always dilute your peppermint oil into a neutral carrier oil and do a patch test first. Never apply to broken or inflamed [skin](https://betterme.world/articles/white-peony-tea-benefits-side-effects/). Freshens Breath Peppermint is a [good choice](https://betterme.world/articles/pomegranate-white-tea-benefits-side-effects/) for freshening breath. This is because it contains menthol which has antiseptic and antibacterial properties that can kill germs in the mouth and reduce bad breath ( [7](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4606594/)). May Soothe Pain And Muscle Soreness Peppermint oil is a common topical remedy for sprains and sore [muscles](https://betterme.world/articles/white-tea-benefits-side-effects/), as it provides a cooling [effect](https://betterme.world/articles/matcha-green-tea-with-turmeric-benefits-side-effects/) and may reduce pain and relax the muscles. Peppermint Tea Side Effects As with all herbs, peppermint tea can cause [side effects](https://betterme.world/articles/lavender-chamomile-tea-benefits-side-effects/) in some people. People who have gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and esophageal spasms should avoid using peppermint tea or at least consult a doctor before doing so ( [12](https://www.webmd.com/diet/peppermint-tea-good-for-you#1)). Peppermint may interact with medications that are processed by the same enzyme pathways as the liver. Side effects include nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhea, dizziness, restlessness, and irritability. So, again, drink peppermint tea only under a doctor's supervision to avoid potential side effects ( [12](https://www.webmd.com/diet/peppermint-tea-good-for-you#1)). If you're allergic to menthols or menthol-producing [plants](https://betterme.world/articles/oolong-tea-benefits-side-effects/), like mint, corn mint, and birch, it's best to avoid peppermint tea. Peppermint oil is also not recommended during pregnancy without first talking to your doctor because it has not been well-studied ( [12](https://www.webmd.com/diet/peppermint-tea-good-for-you#1)). The Bottom Line Peppermint tea is a tasty herbal remedy with potential health benefits. However, peppermint tea benefits are limited to minor health problems and do not work as a miracle weight loss solution. Peppermint should be used as a medicine only under a doctor's supervision, especially if you are taking other medications. If you are pregnant, talk to your doctor.
